intro: Bridelia triplocarya, commonly known as the three-lobed bridelia, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Bridelia triplocarya is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
